intro: Hieracium anideum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, this plant thrives in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often glandular, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hieracium anideum is generally not invasive but can be found in various habitats across its native range.
